FuncDef:
The sma enable command enables the state machine-based anti-spoofing (SMA) function on an AS edge router (AER).
The undo sma enable command disables SMA.
SMA is disabled by default.
ExtraInfo:
To enable SMA on an AER, run the sma enable command in the SMA view displayed using the sma command.
An AER is an edge router on an AS. It adds a tag to a packet that originates from a local AS and is destined for another member AS. The tag is a string that identifies a local AS. Upon receipt of the packet, a member AS verifies the tag information in the local AS's IPv6 address prefix. In addition, the AER verifies the source IPv6 address prefix carried in a packet that a device in a member AS sends to a local AS. The AER discards the packet without a tag or with an incorrect tag.
